p: Thymus carnosus essential oil was slightly more toxic (IC 50 = 0.705 mg/mL) than T. camphoratus oil (IC 50 = 0.848 mg/mL). Nevertheless, at bioactive concentrations, against the majority of the dermatophyte strains, as well as at concentrations that inhibited C. albicans germ tube formation, no toxicity was observed, thus pointing out a safety profile for a further development of topical formulations ( Table 5). Additionally, at lower concentrations (below 0.28 mg/mL) both essential oils increased cell viability ( Table 5). This could be due to an increase in keratinocytes proliferation or due to the stimulation of their mitochondrial activity and therefore, additional studies should be conducted to further understand this event.
